intro: Grindelia pulchella var. discoidea, commonly known as the silverleaf gumweed, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs that reflect sunlight. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clustered heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open woodlands. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a distinctive component of its native habitat.
